meanings.definition: To treat someone as a celebrity or idol.
meanings.sent1: People often lionize famous actors and singers.
meanings.sent2: Fans tend to lionize their favorite pop stars.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone started to lionize the guest of honor.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sports, fans lionize their favorite athletes.
meanings.sent5: The media loves to lionize successful entrepreneurs.

meanings.definition: To give someone a lot of attention and admiration.
meanings.sent1: Children often lionize their parents for their achievements.
meanings.sent2: During the award ceremony, the audience began to lionize the winner.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to lionize its owner whenever he came home.
meanings.sent4: The teacher would lionize students who showed great improvement.
meanings.sent5: The community would lionize volunteers who dedicated their time to help others.

meanings.definition: To make someone famous or well-known.
meanings.sent1: The talent show could lionize undiscovered singers.
meanings.sent2: A viral video can quickly lionize an ordinary person.
meanings.sent3: The magic show promised to lionize the magician as the best in town.
meanings.sent4: A single hit song could lionize a musician overnight.
meanings.sent5: The local newspaper aimed to lionize community heroes in a special feature.
